result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Renorval Xavier Grant

records.addlTxt:
Defendant filed a DEMAND FOR SPEEDY TRIAL. Parties selected new dates that comply with the Speedy Trial deadline. 
Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists at least 48 hours in advance of the Final PreTrial date. 
Court reiterated Motions deadline: Any Motions are due on or before October 31, 2022. Any Responses are due on or before November 18, 2022. 
Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and SPEEDY Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 45. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 09:00 am. Hearing will be held IN-PERSON in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  
SPEEDY Jury Trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 08:30 am. Trial will be held in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant appeared by video.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. appeared by video for Renorval Xavier Grant.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in Court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail. Scheduling Conference proceeded.
Defendant is requesting a bail hearing along with a demand for speedy trial.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Renorval X. Grant - #2022008040, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Speedy Trial.  (Renorval X. Grant - #2022008040, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
EXPIRES JANUARY 10, 2023
No reply from defendant or surety.  tm

Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Renorval Xavier Grant.  Assistant District Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED by the Court.
Order to Produce GF-190 - FPT - 10-06-22; _2 - Obarski, Jon Robert.docx, Filed.

Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant not in court, in custody.  Attorney Avery L Goodrich Jr. in court for Renorval Xavier Grant.  Prosecuting attorney Alicia H Kort in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's appearance waived.  Defense has received the discovery and offer and is requesting a short adjournment for scheduling and  a bail motion.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond, Filed.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.

Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant in court with Attorney Avery L Goodrich; both appear by video.  Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K. Miller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Retainer, Filed.

Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Kallai P., Eric A., Tzell C., Antoine S., Jayla S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant Renorval Xavier Grant in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
